duties_responsibilities.duty: Own and manage all building electrical assets, planning, and documentation for ASML Wilton facilities and manufacturing systems.
Lead the development and implementation of User Requirements Specifications, Engineering Design Guidelines, and Maintenance Policies.
Ensure effective operations, maintenance, and support of facilities and operational services, aligned with strategic pillars.
Monitor and manage contractors, consultants, and suppliers supporting critical assets, systems, and processes.
Act as the expert in electrical systems, managing and coordinating with other competences to ensure alignment and business continuity.
Make key decisions about designs, safety situations, and guidelines that impact the performance and costs of assets.
Collaborate with peers, program managers, project managers, and specialists to support and manage changes and projects in the field.
Support the establishment of strong and clear standards and related sharing, documenting, and distribution of information within the CRE team.
Monitor and coordinate the impact of guidelines and standards on other assets to ensure business continuity.
Cooperate with cross-sector key users and counterparts to assure global alignment and consistency in operations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent; OR 12-15 years of relevant experience in a complex industrial environment. Professional Engineer (PE) preferred.
